column4: can anyone help me with removing a program? i just want to make sure im doing the right thing
did you get the program from the network yes?
if you purge the program it will get rid of some config file stuff as well that you don't want anymore
also if there is anything to do with the program after removing as a hidden .folder in the home folder remove that as well
well if you don't purge there may be some files left behind that were to do with that program,  that you may as well also have deleted
quite a lot of programs will leave user data in the home folder as a hidden folder
it's best to always purge the program and then view hidden files and folders of the home folder and look for any . folder that has anything to do with it and delete that as well if there is one
well that's for  ordindary programs like the one you mentioend and stuff like Firefox
delete the hidden files from the home directory to do with it and then try and open the program again
what torrents program you using now then?
delete the transmission stuff from home and try and opne the program again to see if it will open or not
and synaptec package manager says it isan't even installed?

you can manually find out where the transmission files are and delete them with root/sudo or whatever, but that will be a right pain.  also  the Gnome menu can be edited, but it's not as easy as say editing the Windows start menu
if it says it's not installed you could try to just install it and then purge remove it
and make sure the transmission stuff is gone from home
